title: (x) Two wedding-style scripts - Fine Hand, Helinda Rook {Mike F, Yves}
content:
Hello,

Need Help... Calling the Font Gods!~! Can anyone help me identify these 2 fonts?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071121051254im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/k%20font%202_3587.JPG%20%5Bimg:k%20font%202_5803.JPG)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071121051254im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/j%20font%20help_6255.JPG)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071121051254im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/k%20font%202_5305.JPG)

 [‹ (x) condensed sans body type - ITC Franklin Gothic Cond {Geoff Riding}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071121051254/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36020 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) HomeWatch logo slab serif - Belwe {Peter Spier (self), Tim D} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071121051254/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35672 "Go to next forum topic")
author: bessy77

comments.content: The second one is Bible Script (Font _Gods? Bible_ Script? Is this a coincidence?)

The 2nd is [Fine Hand](http://web.archive.org/web/20071121051254/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/fine-hand/fine-hand/win-ttf/344039/charmap.html?vid=344039&cpselect=CP2) and the caps used are the alternates - which you can see in the Truetype Full Character Map.
So how would I get the capital letters in the Fine Hand? I am looking at the map and its still hard to understand.
ARE YOU SURE THIS IS FINE HAND? I TRIED TO PURCHASE IT AND THE E AND M TAILS DON’T LOOK THE SAME?

Yes we are sure this is Fine Hand. As Mike said, the caps used are the alternates. You can see them in the Truetype Full Character Map. Just scroll down on [this page](http://web.archive.org/web/20071121051254/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/fine-hand/fine-hand/win-ttf/344039/charmap.html?vid=344039&cpselect=CP2).
For future ref: FontShop now has a [full character/glyph showing](http://web.archive.org/web/20071121051254/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/itc/fine_hand/?acs=1).

Coles that’s a wonderful feature!!! When you click on the triangles- it shows related alternate characters. Tres Cool!

Now if only I can control how many results I get per page when browsing foundry listings. Constantly clicking next is not so enjoyable.

Mikey

\> When you click on the triangles- it shows related alternate characters.

Yep, behaves just like the Adobe CS glyph palette as long as the font is OpenType and coded properly.

\> Now if only I can control how many results I get per page when browsing foundry listings.

It’s on the to-do list.
